task-title: The civil unrest in Ethiopia since 2015
task-stmt: Track information on the protests and demonstrations over land rights in Ethiopia since 2015.
task-narr: Since 2015, hundreds have died in Ethiopia triggered initially by demonstration over land rights. The protests broadened into rallies that spread into other regions.  The goal of this task is to map the extent and breadth of these protests, their origins, and their goals.
task-in-scope: Documents may be relevant if they pertain to protests in Ethiopia since 2015.
task-not-in-scope: Protests in Ethiopia in earlier years are out of scope.

dfeceab7c098cf6d3a9724cac4035b0f.segment-text: Since 2015, hundreds have died in violence triggered by demonstrations over land rights in Ethiopia’s Oromiya region. The protests broadened into rallies over freedoms that spread to other regions.

0520104aa1ec081180970e3580115209.segment-text:
Hundreds of people have died in violence sparked initially by an urban development plan for the capital Addis Ababa. The unrest spread in 2015 and 2016 as demonstrations against political restrictions and human rights abuses broke out.
“Unrest and a political crisis have led to the loss of lives and displacement of many

requests.req-text: What are the events that triggered the Ethiopian protest starting in 2015?

6cac9e20dc110718e43bf98257f4c736.segment-text:
Renewed protests have hit Ethiopia's Oromia region, a day after at least 55 people were killed in a stampede triggered by clashes between police and demonstrators at a religious festival.

Police fired tear gas to disperse protesters angered at their handling of Sunday's event, witnesses told the BBC.

Protesters say violence by the security forces led to the stampede, but the PM denied security forces had opened fire.

a8c86c82bf95197d22e522b8aeb7ebe9.segment-text: mass protests in the country's restive Oromia region and elsewhere, calling for greater freedoms, have increased pressure on Hailemariam's government.

requests.req-text: In what regions of Ethiopia have been protests and unrest?

dc60eace63ea78fe14008dc1b9bde66a.segment-text: Most of the unrest has centred on Ethiopia's two largest regions, Oromia and Amhara.

db26c98644741e223da59e7e54a21e19.segment-text:
The state of emergency is being defied in a number of regions. Citizens have protested in Gondar, which is in the opposition Amhara region, as well as the opposition stronghold of Nekemte which is in Oromia. Much of the Oromia region is also defying the emergency measures.
As a result, the regime has targeted the Oromia region, and its protesting youths who are collectively known as Qeerro in the Oromo language.

task-title: An Egyptian Businessman calls for protests against al-Sisi.
task-stmt: This task is showing the purpose and means of protests against al-Sisi in Egypt in 2019.
task-narr: A young business man and moderately famous actor, named Mohammad Ali used to work with the Egyptian army is calling for protests against al-Sisi. Mohammad Ali is revealing the corruption in the Egyptian authority, headed by al-Sisi. The Egyptian people got mad and went to the streets demanding the ouster of al-Sisi. Activists, young men, writers and other people are posting a hashtag on tweeter against al-Sisi.
task-in-scope: The real reasons why Mohammad Ali affected and inspired the Egyptian people to protest.
task-not-in-scope: The United States stand of the protests.

afb35f548223d1920ff1c3aec10f67a6.segment-text: The apparent trigger for the demonstrations was almost as unexpected: Mohamed Ali, a 45-year-old construction contractor and part-time actor who says he got rich building projects for the Egyptian military and then left for Spain to live in self-imposed exile, where he began posting videos on social media accusing Mr. al-Sisi of corruption and hypocrisy.

spans.string: Self-exiled businessman and actor Muhammad Ali
the price of basic goods and necessities

f65115f76dc51111d6ce8d6cf95b348c.segment-text:
The current protests are the most sizable public demonstrations against al-Sisi since he seized power, and have mostly been focused on government corruption. Self-exiled businessman and actor Muhammad Ali released videos detailing instances of graft and corruption by government officials involved with the construction of luxury hotels.

When these high-end projects were juxtaposed against the lagging economic prospects of ordinary Egyptians, people took to the streets demanding reforms. Egypt has also suffered from a rise in the price of basic goods and necessities and cuts to subsidies that had long helped ease the economic burden on Egypt’s working class.

requests.req-text: Find the protests' dates and locations.

spans.string: the Red Sea city of Suez

afb35f548223d1920ff1c3aec10f67a6.segment-text: On Saturday evening, about 200 protesters in the Red Sea city of Suez were met with police officers firing rubber bullets, according to posts on social media and a witness.

spans.string: a key site of the 2011 Egyptian Revolution

33c86214a0e4c140f5a6fa9c8c9aef34.segment-text:
Hundreds of Egyptians filled Tahrir Square in Cairo - a key site of the 2011 Egyptian Revolution - demanding his resignation.

Demonstrations also took place elsewhere around the country.

requests.req-text: How many people attended each protest, and who estimated that number?

44c6c0dab1ccbc921c715f9224b80c7c.segment-text:
Thousands of demonstrators reportedly took to the streets on Friday and Saturday as part of an unprecedented wave of dissent – more easily expressed online – sparked by allegations of corruption in Sisi’s government and military.

Videos published by former government contractor Mohamed Ali went viral earlier this month.

a16801145034abf839898edf73996026.segment-text: Tens of hundreds of people took to the streets across Egypt calling for the removal of Abdel Fattah al-Sisi.

task-title: Lebanese anti-corruption protests in Tripoli in 2019 and 2020
task-stmt: To understand the nature of the protests in the city of Tripoli, Lebanon, against political corruption in 2019 and 2020.
task-narr: Since 2019, Lebanon witnessed a revolution against the corrupted Lebanese political class, which has ruled the country since its civil war. During that time, Tripoli, a city in Northern Lebanon was called  "the bride of the revolution," both because of its energetic protests and because it was believed to have borne the brunt of political corruption. Tens of thousands of Tripoli protesters flocked onto the streets demanding reforms.
task-in-scope: Any relevant information related to the protests, poverty and economic situation.
task-not-in-scope: Any information related to the low wages of teachers.

ad6e53f17b1ccc4d5fb549974dd2c51e.segment-text: Demonstrators also took to the streets in Lebanon’s second city of Tripoli.

375f097a17b76a05dfdc9d1d69bc97ae.segment-text: In Tripoli, Lebanon’s traditionally conservative second city, the protests at points looked like a music festival on Saturday evening, with a DJ pumping out dance music from loudspeakers.

requests.req-text: Identify the demands of the protesters.

6fcf331c8ee573d4b0ad0b9870ee4c1a.segment-text: The protesters have been demanding the new Cabinet not include politicians but consist of experts who can work on getting Lebanon out of its economic crisis.

e5cf1bb3ab27a448823c1727981bd7d8.segment-text: Protests against growing economic hardship erupted in Tripoli and spread to other Lebanese cities on Tuesday, with banks set ablaze and violence boiling over into a second night.

requests.req-text: Identify the reasons behind these protests.

9da659421e58d130ef65acd745e4c746.segment-text: "Tripoli is revolting because it is neglected and oppressed," said Nafez Muqadam, a 60-year-old activist and doctor

8275b3df4c7df6646de26de47d65715c.segment-text:
Demonstrators in his hometown of Tripoli in northern Lebanon wasted no time in rejecting Safadi. They gathered near one of his properties to protest against a reported nomination they regard as a provocation.

"Choosing Mohammed Safadi for prime minister proves that the politicians who rule us are in a deep coma, as if they were on another planet," said Jamal Badawi, 60.

Another protester said that as a business tycoon and former minister, Safadi was an embodiment of the kind of political class the protest movement wants to remove.

task-title: Slogans chanted during the Lebanese protests in Beirut in 2019 2020
task-stmt: Understand the nature of slogans chanted against corrupt politicians during the Lebanese revolution in Beirut in 2019 and 2020.
task-narr: Back in October of 2019, a widespread series of coordinated protests took place in a number of places in Beirut. These protests were against corrupt politicians in the government. One thing that caught the media's attention was the creative slogans used during these protests.
task-in-scope: Slogans may be relevant if they pertain to this series of protests taking place during this time period including Beirut explosion protests.
task-not-in-scope: Slogans regarding the trash crisis called the "You Stink" protests.

cb8cdc27711a7c5f3fa6501e99d581ac.segment-text: From the popular refrain of the 2011 Arab uprisings to ingenious street slogans denouncing a "corrupt" ruling elite, the chants of Lebanon's protests have been a mix of defiance and humor.

21d0895909f9df1b4593740ba80890f8.segment-text: "All of them means all of them," protesters chanted on Sunday in central Beirut, a reference to the removal of an elite they accuse of pillaging the state and steering it into crisis.

requests.req-text: Identify physical location and date of protests.

1630fdd5168e11054789e1ae3074eff8.segment-text: Thousands of protesters rallying against the Lebanese political elite blocked roads in central Beirut on Tuesday, preventing lawmakers from reaching the parliament and forcing the postponement of a legislative session.

the entrance to Downtown from Kantari

21d0895909f9df1b4593740ba80890f8.segment-text: Tens of thousands of Lebanese packed on Sunday into central Beirut for an anti-government demonstration

23f2f4ca41c0481f3b35d7968d325e63.segment-text: Meanwhile, hundreds of protesters marched toward central Beirut amid a deepening economic crisis

task-stmt: To understand the nature of protests against the government in Tunisia, taking place in 2018 and 2019, and the official reactions against the the protests.
task-narr: In 2018 and 2019, many protests took place in Tunisia. Protests erupted in multiple towns and cities across Tunisia over issues related to the cost of living and taxes. The protests had claimed at least one life and revived worries about the fragile political situation in Tunisia.
task-in-scope: Protests against taxes and high prices
task-not-in-scope: Protests against Saudi King's visit to Tunisia after Khashokgi's death.

9b152e5a490389d5fe26d55da5f48fd2.segment-text: On Thursday, unrest was limited to sporadic clashes in the northern city of Siliana, in Sidi Bouzid in central Tunisia and Douz in the south of the North African country.

a14ee860099c1a0dd960b313ce8851ba.segment-text: “The people want the overthrow of the government”, “Power belongs to the people”, they chanted

requests.req-text: Identify the locations of the protests.

0b3d964d1740e292c3e97869c1f23716.segment-text:
For several weeks, about 1,000 protesters in Tatouine province, where Italy’s ENI and Austria’s OMV have gas operations, have been demanding jobs and a share in revenue from the area’s natural resources.

Protests have also broken out in another southern province, Kebili, and on Wednesday police fired tear gas to break up rioting in a town west of Tunis after a fruit seller set himself on fire in protest against the police.

a55b5208d228abb4b844750648d4e6b8.segment-text: Tunisia on Tuesday declared a curfew in the city of Kasserine after clashes between the police and more than 1,000 young protesters demonstrating for jobs.

requests.req-text: How many people were arrested or detained during protests?

9b152e5a490389d5fe26d55da5f48fd2.segment-text: Tunisian authorities arrested another 150 people including local opposition leaders on Friday, bringing the total detained close to 800 in response to demonstrations this week against price and tax rises.

88ddb51d228e8d1d8b88db40b40fb56a.segment-text: Security forces have reportedly arrested more than 230 people in the protests, which were triggered by unemployment and rising prices of basic goods.

task-stmt: To understand the Iraqi government suppression of demonstrations that took place in Baghdad 2019 against the government officials corruption
task-narr: In October 2019, a new and strong wave of demonstrations began in Baghdad and a number of Iraqi provinces, which were considered the strongest and most violent in the country since 2003 and the beginning of the US occupation of Iraq. The demonstrations resulted in thousands of deaths and injuries, followed by the resignation of Prime Minister Adel Abdul Mahdi.
task-in-scope: Any demonstration from October to December 2019

9cd21af0a3908d017098532db4362e16.segment-text: Iraq’s parliament voted on Sunday to accept the resignation of Prime Minister Adel Abdul Mahdi after weeks of violent anti-government protests that have rocked the country.

d8f8e2309f03fd40cb07615a94d7bd9c.segment-text: The Iraqi parliament's approval of Prime Minister Adel Abdul Mahdi's resignation pleased the anti-government demonstrators, but was not enough to stop their protests.

requests.req-text: How many people took part in the protests?

spans.string: other cities in central and southern Iraq

d8f8e2309f03fd40cb07615a94d7bd9c.segment-text: Mass demonstrations have continued in the capital Baghdad and other cities in central and southern Iraq since early October

5b2e59956f8a7c8e3b9635380014b20b.segment-text: Tens of thousands resumed mass demonstrations to demand an end to endemic corruption and economic hardships, which they blame on the current system of government.

requests.req-text: What political changes are sought by the protest leaders?

5b2e59956f8a7c8e3b9635380014b20b.segment-text: Tens of thousands resumed mass demonstrations to demand an end to endemic corruption and economic hardships, which they blame on the current system of government.

b78afae3cef9dd24987a9de754ddb18a.segment-text: More than 400 people have been killed since the uprising shook Iraq on October 1, with thousands of Iraqis taking to the streets in Baghdad and the predominantly Shia south, decrying corruption, poor services, lack of jobs and calling for an end to the post-2003 political system.

task-stmt: To study how the Basra protests changed from demanding job opportunities to attacking Iranian militias.
task-narr:
In July 2018, demonstrations began in Basra, the province, which is the economic capital of Iraq. The demonstrators first demanded the provision of electricity and water, and the provision of job opportunities, but the protests took a violent nature when the security forces killed demonstrators, which led to the burning Iranian consulate in Basra, a number of political parties' headquarters and the headquarters of militias loyal to Iran.
The situation did not calm down until after the intervention of Ayatollah Sistani and several international parties.
task-in-scope: All documents that cover the demonstrations in Basra province in 2018
task-not-in-scope: Basra demonstrations that happened before 2018 are not in scope

spans.string: the entrance to Iraq’s Khor al-Zubair commodities port

574c0dcf38d15bb308effe4f8df678cc.segment-text: Protesters have blocked the entrance to Iraq’s Khor al-Zubair commodities port near Basra, preventing trucks from entering, port officials told Reuters on Tuesday, as the biggest wave of anti-government demonstrations in decades continue.

spans.string: the ultimate authority for devout members of Iraq’s Shi’ite majority

d8254ee6a1c069f413c03cb88095136c.segment-text: Ayatollah Ali Sistani, the ultimate authority for devout members of Iraq’s Shi’ite majority who normally holds himself above day-to-day politics, placed blame for the unrest with political leaders and said a new government should be formed, “different from its predecessors”.

task-title: Protest in Tunis against political Islam after secular politician slain
task-stmt: Tunisian opposition politician Mohamed Brahmi was shot dead on Thursday in the second such assassination this year, setting off violent protests against the Islamist-led government in the capital and elsewhere.
task-narr:
Tunisian opposition politician Mohamed Brahmi was shot dead outside his home in Tunis  in the second such assassination this year, setting off violent protests against the Islamist-led government in the capital and elsewhere. 
The demonstrations undermined the influence of the Salafi movements supported by the Nahda movement led by Rashid Ghannouchi, after the demonstrations met with international support.
task-in-scope: Tunisian Mohamed Brahmi assassinated protest at same period of time

666079cc579594a9582c20f60732ca0f.segment-text: Tunisian opposition politician Mohamed Brahmi was shot dead on Thursday in the second such assassination this year, setting off violent protests against the Islamist-led government in the capital and elsewhere.

spans.string: Tunisian opposition party leader Mohamed Brahmi

26fc63546001f83f5df90abe6b7a58ae.segment-text:
Tunisian opposition party leader Mohamed Brahmi has been shot dead in the capital, Tunis, in the country's second political killing this year.

Protesters have gathered in Tunis and other cities across the country calling for the government to resign.

Tunisia's largest trade union has called for a general strike on Friday and Tunisair has cancelled all flights to and from Tunisia for that day.

requests.req-text: How is the Tunisian government responding to Brahmi's assassination?

26fc63546001f83f5df90abe6b7a58ae.segment-text: Prime Minister Ali Larayedh condemned his assassination, but said: "We are against all calls to dissolve the government to create a [power] vacuum."

spans.string: the hardline Salafist Ansar al-Sharia movement

55fd9600e8e76a6eba0609671cf0e666.segment-text:
Tunisia has designated the hardline Salafist Ansar al-Sharia movement a "terrorist group", blaming it for the killing of two secular politicians.

PM Ali Larayedh said he had proof it was behind the killings of Chokri Belaid and Mohamed Brahmi, which plunged Tunisia into political turmoil.

requests.req-text: Find articles that mention the locations of the protests.

26fc63546001f83f5df90abe6b7a58ae.segment-text: Meanwhile, reports are emerging of police firing tear gas to disperse demonstrators who allegedly stormed a local government office in the southern city of Sfax.

spans.string: a hospital in the Ariana district
outside the Interior Ministry in Tunis

666079cc579594a9582c20f60732ca0f.segment-text: Thousands of people protested outside the Interior Ministry in Tunis and a hospital in the Ariana district where Brahmi’s body had been taken. “Down with the rule of the Islamists,” they chanted, and demanded that the government resign.
